contextId.information: Jeremiah may have been exaggerating to show his fear of speaking in public. AT: "I do not know how to speak in public" or "I do not know how to make announcements to people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: I do not know how to speak

contextId.information: This is a generalization. It refers to the kings of the northern kingdoms. AT: "every king" or "all of the northern kings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

The tops of hills and under shade trees were common places for people to worship idols. The word "every" is used as a generalization to show that the people were worshiping idols in many different places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: every high hill and under every leafy tree

contextId.information: The word "my" refers to Jeremiah. AT: "I am very sad." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
AT: "more than you can count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: more than the sands of the seashore

contextId.information: This exaggeration is used to show the level of sinfulness which was present at the time of Jeremiah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: the land is full of adulterers

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration of the joy Israelites will have. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: they will never again feel any more sorrow
the rest of the people who were left in the city

contextId.information: "among the people who remained in Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"the people of Judah that have come to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all of Judah that has been gathered to you

contextId.information: This probably did not include every individual there. It is a generalization that mean many people. AT: "many of the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

Here "Every person" is a generalization that means "very many people." Also, "sword" represents enemies carrying weapons. AT: "Nearly every person of Judah in the land of Egypt will die. Enemies will kill many of them and many of them will starve to death until there is very few of them left" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Every person of Judah in the land of Egypt will perish by sword and famine until they are all finished

contextId.information: AT: everyone can hear your crying. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: The earth is filled with your laments

contextId.information: This command is an exaggeration, because no one can put wings on people. Also, the idea of flying away represents the idea of rapidly running away. AT: "Help the people of Moab escape," "It would be good if the people of Moab had wings and could fly away." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The purpose of this exaggeration is to tell the failure of Edom will be severe. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: At the sound of their falling the earth shakes. The sound of distressed shouts is heard at the Sea of Reeds

contextId.information: This shows Jeremiah's feeling that people who believe in idols are very stupid! (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: Every man becomes like an animal without knowledge
